newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - July 18.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - July 18.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
PEOPLE'S DAILY
- Chinese Communist Party and State Council issue circular calling for resolute actions to halt collection of illicit fees from enterprises.
- Front page report hails 50th anniversary of founding of Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region
- Campaign urging people to end uncivilised behaviour launched in eastern Xiamen city in nationwide drive to promote ethnic and cultural progress.

- Front page editorial describes open-ended grain purchasing at protective prices as key government measure to protect farmers' interests, increase their incomes and arouse interest in grain production.
XINHUA DAILY TELEGRAPH
-- Communist Party Discipline Inspection Commission and Ministry of Supervision issue circular urging officials to stop using luxury cars
FINANCIAL NEWS
- Industrial and Commercial Bank of China plans to set up supervision committee
- China formally sets up China Nuclear Finance Co with capital of 326 million yuan
- Editorial reminds investors not to readily believe performance of some listed firms
CHINA SECURITIES
- Central bank issues People's Bank of Chian Monetary Supervision Regulations
ECONOMIC DAILY
- Production of fertiliser reaches 13.407 million tonnes in first half, up 4.7 percent year-on-year
- First half consumer price inflation up 4.1 percent year-on-year
ECONOMIC INFORMATION DAILY
- China becomes second biggest buyer of second-hand ships
- Shanghai launches China's first international paging service
WORKERS DAILY
- Editorial says people should take new view on finding a job and should not have too high expectations
CHINA DAILY
- Chinese Vice-Premier and Foreign Minister Qian Qichen voices hope conflicting parties in Cambodia can bring situation back to normal as soon as possible.
- China Charity Federation will help about 1,200 cleft palate-afflicted orphans to have plastic surgery this year.
- Cooler summer days are back in north China after two weeks of scorching heat.
